title: Loud subshells
description:
Default shells usually end in $. Unless you’re root and it’s #. That tradition has been around forever: people recognized the need to highlight you’re not just some random shmoe.

These days we have lots of snazzy shell magic. You might still su, but you’re more likely to sudo. We still temporarily assume extra privileges. If you have access to more than one set of systems, like production and staging, you probably have ways of putting on a particular hat. Some combination of setting an environment variable, adding a key to ssh-agent, or assuming aws AWS role with aws-vault. You know, so you don’t accidentally blow away prod.

title: Practical Applications of JSON: Why and Where You Should Use It
description:
CockroachDB provides scale without sacrificing SQL functionality. It offers fully-distributed ACID transactions, zero-downtime schema changes, and support for secondary indexes and foreign keys.
But what about some of the additional benefits NoSQL databases provide such as the ability to use semi-structured data?
CockroachDB listened to our customers and realized that we needed to provide options for managing rapid development, data without a clear schema or whose schema you do not control, and impedance mismatches.
